description: a(n+1) is smallest multiple of (sum of digits of a(n)) which is > a(n).
comments: a(n) mod 9 = 0 for n > 8. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 28 2011]
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
prog: (Haskell)a045776 n = a045776_list !! na045776_list = iterate f 1 where   f x = head $ dropWhile (<= x) [q,2*q..] where q = a007953 x-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 28 2011
author: _Erich Friedman_
